transcript_text: Good afternoon. This is Jim. Hey, Jim. Bob Meissner. How are you, my old friend? I'm well, Bob. How are you? Well, I'm great. I'm great. And in a way, that's a real sadness, and I hope you're taking this well. We have had a lot And I think it's just We've been around 26, 27 years And people are starting to That started at the beginning Are starting to get retired So we have been having a little bump in Retirements and people just closing down And separating and doing their own thing Oh absolutely And I think we were with you From the very, very beginning Because I remember working with Tim Lawler I don't think he works with you anymore but Lawler and Associates in Wisconsin, that's where I started, and I have my own office, blah, blah, blah. Now I've absolutely positively concluded I can't. And, Jim, does it mean that my files and all that data is deleted, or is it archived and where a year from now or somebody couldn't come and buy into being able to look at that data? How does that work? Well, we archive it, and it's there for about a year, usually a little bit longer than a year, so that if something did happen that you wanted to turn it back on or anything like that, you could kind of turn it back on, or if you sold it to someone, we should probably have it, and we could get it and just turn it back on. if you wanted to request a data return we could make the database the sequel database available for you for download then you could keep it wherever you have and you wouldn't need us you could just give it to someone else they could take it back to PC recruiter or anywhere else yeah well I think it's a assist or the other option is if you need a data perhaps to get a hold of anyone you could push it out into a CSV just like export a roll-up list take the data you need from there that way it's usable but you couldn't really yeah but you could give it some but it wouldn't be the full database it would just be field data well it's so bizarre like for example um uh we have because i'm a latin american area specialist there were dozens and dozens of individuals who were uh in my database for latin america all over and um One of them, I have no way of being able to get a hold of them, the Fodrejo family in Colombia. And the only place I would turn to would be PC Recruiter to dig into that. I wouldn't even know how anymore to access that right now, this minute. I wouldn't even know how to get a hold of, you know, go in there because I haven't been inside PC Recruiter for five years. I haven't looked at one single contact in PC recruiters since 2019 or 2020. It's just, I'm not sure how I'd get into that. So I think that's it. So I won't have another charge. Is that correct? I sure hope I'm charge-free now, no more invoices. I don't think so. Nick and Robin will confirm if you do. I don't think so because it looks like you would have renewed on the 12th, so there probably wouldn't be a charge. No, and I'd really like that forgiven. And I just really would like to just say, hey, if you're not using it, it was on hold, there wasn't much value per se. Yes, there was a lot of value per se if you lit up the fire again, but that'd be great if I didn't go through that again. I just don't want, I'm trying to do a budget. We've been able to close enough new business to offset the people leaving and retiring and everything like that. So we're doing all right. We're doing all right. Excellent. Excellent to hear that. Well, that's it, my friend. I'll just wait. I did get that confirmation. It's much appreciated much appreciated Take care of my friend. Be well the summer. Take care. All right. You take care. Bye. Bye

sentiment_analysis.summary: The customer, Bob Meissner, is a long-time user of PC Recruiter who is now retiring and closing down his account. He discusses the process of archiving his data, the ability to retrieve it in the future, and requests that any remaining charges be forgiven, which the agent agrees to look into.

process_improvements: Implement an automated archiving and data retrieval system to streamline the process for retiring customers and ensure easy access to historical data.
Develop clear documentation and training materials for employees on the account closure and data archiving/retrieval process to ensure consistency and efficiency.

Explore opportunities to integrate customer data export functionality directly into the platform, allowing users to easily download their data in various formats (e.g., CSV, SQL) without relying on support staff.

strengths: The employee demonstrated excellent customer service skills, being patient and understanding of the customer's situation.
The employee provided clear explanations of the data archiving and retrieval process, helping to address the customer's concerns.
improvements: The employee could have proactively offered to waive any remaining charges, rather than waiting for the customer to request it.
suggested_phrases: I'd be happy to waive any remaining charges for your account, as you're retiring and no longer using the service.

follow_up_actions: Confirm with the billing team that any remaining charges for the customer's account have been waived.
Reach out to the customer to ensure they are satisfied with the resolution and provide any additional assistance they may need with data retrieval or account closure.
Review the customer's feedback and incorporate it into the development of a more streamlined account closure and data archiving process.
knowledge_base_updates: Create a comprehensive guide on the account closure and data archiving/retrieval process for retiring customers, including step-by-step instructions and common scenarios.
Develop FAQ content on data export options and the timeline for accessing archived data after account closure.

escalation.reason: The call was handled well, and the customer's concerns were addressed satisfactorily.

call_resolution.problem_statement: The customer, Bob Meissner, is inquiring about the status of his PC Recruiter account and data after deciding to discontinue the service. He is concerned about accessing his old data and contacts, as well as any outstanding charges.
call_resolution.resolution_details: The employee, Jim Lombardo, explained that Bob's data will be archived for about a year, and he can request a data export if needed. However, the issue of any outstanding charges was not fully resolved, as Jim said he would need to confirm with the billing team.

follow_up.details: Jim needs to follow up with the billing team to confirm if there are any outstanding charges for Bob's account, and if they can be waived or forgiven.

missed_best_practices: Providing a clear timeline for the follow-up
Offering the customer's direct contact information in case they need to reach out
improvement_suggestions: Clearly communicate the timeline for the billing team follow-up
Provide the customer with a direct contact or reference number in case they need to follow up
